description: More than 150,000 U.S., British and Canadian troops stormed the beaches of Normandy, France, on June 6, 1944 — 80 years ago this week. A small handful told NPR about their experience.
title: They were there on D-Day, on the beaches and in the skies. This is what they saw

description: Ahead of the NBA Finals tipoff, Grant Hill, Naismith Hall of Famer and minority owner of the Atlanta Hawks, talks about the identities of both Boston Celtics and Dallas Mavericks and who has the edge.
title: Naismith Hall of Famer Grant Hill weighs in on NBA finals and Olympic goals ahead

description: The government program called Supplemental Security Income has lots of outdated rules that harm the people it's supposed to help, like people with significant disabilities and their caregivers.
title: A mother has been able to care for her son with SSI. But the program also limits them

description: Crows can count... out loud! They do so similarly to human toddlers who are learning to tally things up. A neuroscientist trained birds to produce a number of calls in response to random visual cues.
title: Crows can count vocally like toddlers, research shows

description: As the U.S. started turning down people seeking asylum at the Southern border following president Biden’s asylum restrictions EO, we explain how border patrol agents, CBP and other federal law enforcement officials are implementing these measures. We try to explain what’s changed in the last few days.
title: How Biden's asylum restriction has changed things at the border with Mexico

description: Israel dropped a bomb on a U.N.-run school it said was being used by Hamas. The blast killed dozens, including women and children, medics and witnesses say. The bomb was U.S.-made, NPR has discovered.
title: Israel used a U.S.-made bomb in a deadly U.N. school strike in Gaza

description: The fungus takes over cicadas’ lower halves and sex drives, fueling them to keep mating and spreading the disease in the process. That's why some scientists call them “flying salt shakers of death.”
title: A fungus is turning cicadas into horny zombies — but don’t panic

description: The annual march, part of Jerusalem Day, a national holiday, regularly inflames Israeli-Palestinian tensions. This year those tensions were even higher because of the war in Gaza.
title: Tens of thousands of Israeli nationalists march for Jerusalem Day

description: Spending time outside in scorching weather can put you at risk of heat stroke or exhaustion. Here's what to watch out for and how to stay safe.
title: 8 mistakes to avoid if you're going out in the heat

description: A new report by an Israeli watchdog group ties an Israeli firm to a covert online campaign intended to sway crucial Democratic lawmakers to continue backing Israel’s campaign in Gaza.
title: A covert Israeli online influence campaign tried to sway American lawmakers

description: The Post's new CEO Will Lewis tried to stop the paper from publishing a story about allegations he faces in Britain. It wasn't the first time he's attempted to head off unwanted coverage. I know, because he tried to do that to me in December.
title: 'Washington Post' publisher tried to kill a story about allegations against him. It wasn’t the first time.

description: While reporting on Harvey Weinstein, Farrow unearthed details of the National Enquirer’s plan to pay for damaging stories about Trump and then bury the stories — a practice known as "catch and kill."
title: How Ronan Farrow's reporting on Weinstein led to the criminal case against Trump

description: The amount of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere hit an all time high in May. That trend must reverse in order to rein in climate change.
title: There is more carbon dioxide than ever in the atmosphere. That’s bad for the climate

description: President Biden said the historic invasion is a reminder of the costs of freedom and democracy — and the value of alliances. He evoked Ukraine, saying the U.S., NATO and its allies won't "walk away."
title: Biden commemorates D-Day invasion's 80th anniversary, linking it to Ukraine conflict

description: The Biden campaign announced a new hire to head their effort to court Republican voters. It's part of a recent push from the Biden campaign to make inroads with GOP voters who don't like Trump.
title: The Biden campaign is courting an unexpected group of voters: Republicans

description: A new report shows that tens of millions of children around the world are not getting enough to eat. This leaves a staggering number of kids under five with diseases associated with malnutrition which often impair a child's development and therefore  their future prospects as well.
title: Are we doing better on child hunger?  A sweeping UNICEF report weighs in

description: Israel launched an airstrike on a U.N.-run school in Gaza as part of a new ground and air operation. A health clinic in Georgia specializes in caring for the uninsured.
title: Israel strikes U.N-run school in Gaza; a Georgia clinic cares for the uninsured

description: Many states, like crucial Nevada, allow mail ballots that are postmarked on or before Election Day to be counted — even if they arrive after Election Day. Republicans say this violates federal law.
title: Republicans are targeting late-arriving mail ballots ahead of the 2024 election

description: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Democratic Sen. Alex Padilla of California about President Biden's executive order banning most asylum-seekers from entering the U.S.
title: Some Democrats say Biden's ban on most asylum-seekers goes too far

description: A new study finds telehealth for cancer treatment could make a big difference in reducing carbon footprint of health care. Health care generated 8.5% of U.S. greenhouse gas emissions and there’s a growing effort in medicine to find ways to reduce this impact.
title: How to reduce health care’s climate impact? Increase telehealth

description: A lot hangs in the balance on who former President Donald Trump chooses as his running mate: the vice presidential nominee might shape the MAGA movement or could woo voters who lean moderate.
title: The Veepstakes is on. Here are 10 Republicans Trump could pick to be his running mate

description: Since a failed presidential bid, Sen. Tim Scott has been one of Trump's strongest supporters. Now, as the former president readies to pick a running mate, Scott is focused on winning him Black voters.
title: With the veepstakes on, Tim Scott thinks he can deliver the Black votes Trump wants

description: Supreme Court Justice Samuel Alito says the reason an upside down U.S. flag was flying at his house, was that his wife put it up because of a beef with a neighbor. We’ll hear from that neighbor.
title: The neighbor at the center of the Justice Alito flag controversy speaks out

description: NPR's A Martínez visits Georgia to explore how people without health insurance receive care.
title: A visit to a clinic in Georgia that provides health care only to the uninsured

description: NPR's A Martínez talks to Gabriel Sanchez, senior fellow in Governance Studies at Brookings Institution, about the health care issues that voters are concerned with.
title: What are the health care issues that voters are focused on?

description: After a 5 year restoration an important prehistoric native site in Texas, the Caddo Mounds, has just reopened. It marks an important step in the state’s effort to preserve  Caddo culture and history.
title: Caddo Mounds historic site reopens 5 years after it was destroyed by a tornado

description: This is the fourth test for Starship, this time, the company hopes it will successful return to earth.
title: Elon Musk’s giant Starship rocket prepares to launch again

description: Early adolescence is a time when kids are becoming more independent and spending more time on social media. When it comes to curbing screen time in this age group, new research suggests some parental strategies work better than others.
title: Give yourself and your kids a break — from screen time and from guilt

description: The hallmarks of Russian-backed influence are consistent: trying to erode support for Ukraine, discrediting democratic institutions and seizing on existing political divides.
title: Russian propaganda is using deepfakes, sham websites and social media swarms

description: President Biden is joining other European leaders in Normandy to mark the 80th anniversary of the D-Day landings that began the liberation of the continent from Nazi occupation in World War 2.
title: On the 80th anniversary of D-Day, remembering a generation that will soon be gone

description: Israeli troops have launched a new offensive in central Gaza. A neighbor at the center of the Justice Alito flag controversy speaks out. The EU holds its election for parliament this weekend.
title: Morning news brief

description: Despite progress in some countries -- Chad, Nepal and Peru for example -- A new report from UNICEF looks at rates of "extreme hunger" among children age 5 and under.
title: 1 in 4 children globally lives in severe child food poverty, UNICEF report says

description: A major education issue this year is the alarming number of students who have missed many days of school -- in some cases more than 20. A poll examines parents' attitudes toward chronic absenteeism.
title: Some states are seeing chronic absenteeism soar to more than 40% of students

description: More than 150 people across more than 20 states have fallen ill after being exposed to cucumbers that were possibly contaminated with salmonella, the CDC said Wednesday. No deaths have been reported.
title: More than 150 in U.S. became sick due to a possible salmonella outbreak in cucumbers

description: The administration set a new staffing standard for nursing homes that receive Medicare and Medicaid. It's an effort to keep people safer -- but patients and their families say it is still not enough.
title: Biden administration takes steps to increase staffing levels at nursing homes

description: The controversial congestion pricing program was created to try to ease traffic.The plan would have charged motorists $15 to enter the busiest parts of Manhattan.
title: New York's governor puts the brakes on congestion pricing for NYC

description: The European Union is the world’s second-biggest democracy -- its 27 member states are home to 450 million citizens, and this election is a once-every-five-year event.
title: The European Union holds its election for parliament this weekend

description: A wealthy Baton Rouge neighborhood has become its own city in order to try to create a new school district. Some residents call the move modern day segregation.
title: Louisiana court says mostly white enclave in Baton Rouge may secede and form its own city

description: NPR's Michel Martin talks to TV analyst and former U.S. men's national team star Cobi Jones about 25-year-old French phenom Kylian Mbappé joining Spanish club Real Madrid.
title: The world's best soccer player is taking his talents to the world's No. 1 team

description: Fico pledged to be back at work in a month and said he felt "no hatred" towards his attacker, but he blamed the opposition: "It's evident that he only was a messenger of evil and political hatred."
title: Slovakia's Fico says his views on Ukraine were behind his assassination attempt

description: Researchers say the creatures pose little threat to humans but they are concerned about the growing prevalence of invasive species — a problem made worse by global trade and climate change.
title: Joro spiders are big and colorful, but they shouldn't be nightmare fodder
